intro: Sericolea glabra, commonly known as the smooth sericolea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, dry fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Sericolea glabra is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
